author: Special Correspondent
text:
A case has been registered against a Special Sub-Inspector of Thirukoshtiyur police station and his wife on charges of cheating after running a chit business.

The district police have registered First Information Report (FIR) against SSI Ramu and his wife Podhum Ponnu on the orders of the local Judicial Magistrate court on a petition filed by M. Senthamarai (46), who alleged that the SSI and his wife had cheated him to the tune of Rs. 40 lakh.

The complainant said that the SSI and his wife had collected money during 2011-12 for offering consolidated chit funds of Rs. 5 lakh, Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 20 lakh and failed to honour the complainant after he paid the monthly contributions.

The complainant also alleged that he had pledged his house as collateral security after he had borrowed money from the SSI but failed to return the property even after he cleared the debts. As the local police failed to register a case, he had moved the court, he added.
title: Cheating case registered against SSI and wife
